remarks: This lemma proves the existence of a function p as in the proof of Lemma 1 in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 90: p is in the subalgebra, such that 0 <= p <= 1, p_(t_0) = 0, and p > 0 on T - U. Here Z is used to represent t_0 in the paper.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:

stoweidlem55.3 $e |- K = ( topGen ` ran (,) ) $.
stoweidlem55.4 $e |- ( ph -> J e. Comp ) $.
stoweidlem55.5 $e |- T = U. J $.
stoweidlem55.6 $e |- C = ( J Cn K ) $.
stoweidlem55.7 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ C ) $.
stoweidlem55.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) + ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem55.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem55.10 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. RR ) -> ( t e. T |-> x ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem55.11 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( r e. T /\ t e. T /\ r =/= t ) ) -> E. q e. A ( q ` r ) =/= ( q ` t ) ) $.
stoweidlem55.12 $e |- ( ph -> U e. J ) $.
stoweidlem55.13 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. U ) $.
stoweidlem55.14 $e |- Q = { h e. A | ( ( h ` Z ) = 0 /\ A. t e. T ( 0 <_ ( h ` t ) /\ ( h ` t ) <_ 1 ) ) } $.
stoweidlem55.15 $e |- W = { w e. J | E. h e. Q w = { t e. T | 0 < ( h ` t ) } } $.
stoweidlem55 $p |- ( ph -> E. p e. A ( A. t e. T ( 0 <_ ( p ` t ) /\ ( p ` t ) <_ 1 ) /\ ( p ` Z ) = 0 /\ A. t e. ( T \ U ) 0 < ( p ` t ) ) ) $.
